attributes.action: Take away Sir Christopher Chope' s knighthood.
attributes.additional_details:
Other legislation he has blocked or voted against:

Pardoning Alan Turing

Equal marriage

Outlawing revenge evictions

Exempting carers from hospital parking charges

Banning the use of animals in circus acts 

Investigation of bullying by the Speaker of the House of Commons 

Legal protection for Police horses and dogs being attacked 


Legislation he has advocated:

Abolishing the minimum wage

Reintroduction of the death penalty

Reintroduction of conscription 

A "Burka ban"
attributes.background: Sir Christopher Chope's knighthood brings shame to the honours system, given his history of blocking entirely reasonable legislation, culminating in the "upskirting" bill. He deserves to be forced to forfeit this title as an example to other MPs who seem to enjoy such legislative wrecking.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions asking for people's honours to be taken away. You can find out more about how honours are taken away here:

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/having-honours-taken-away-forfeiture

If you'd like the procedure of objecting to Bills to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/222338

If you'd like the law on upskirting to change, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/216290
